text: I think anybody who's pushing who's
pushing the edge you know I mean if if
if in fact that's what one is
authentically doing but any individual
who is truly ahead of their own time uh
is is uh is usually uh not appreciated
and also is seen as a threat so most
Pioneers most most pioneers have had to
uh suffer uh some
mortally uh uh because they were ahead
of their own time and that and that that
seems to be part of the course you know
a lot of people think it's a very
romantic thing to be a Pioneer uh but uh
but for those individuals who
authentically are I mean obviously on a
personal level it would be it it would
definitely be challenging and in my case
that yes that's definitely been the case
especially because I
have uh especially over the last 10
years I I've been speaking very
passionately about I think we as I was
saying earlier we need to
reorient our our our our spirituality
and the goal of our spirituality from
the urge to transcend the
world um to the to the to the aspiration
to create it and and I I find it very
ironic that so much of of of of
postmodern um mystical uh East Meets
West spirituality and I'm we're speaking
about uh uh
um an an interesting conglomeration of
ideas that is designed specifically for
the for the wealthiest most privileged
most educated people that have ever
lived that really is about escapism it's
it you know because when we hear so many
spiritual teachers speak to us they're
talking about the need to discover inner
peace they're they're they're they're
they're promising US release and relief
and I often telling people but first of
all I don't think God created the
universe so you and I could be happy in
other words we all want to be happy and
there's nothing wrong with being happy
and I want to be happy too but I don't
think that's the reason that I'm alive
and and and suffering is an inherent
part of being alive suffering suffering
and chaos is part of the creative
process from the very beginning you know
I mean the universe the universe wasn't
created uh uh out uh it wasn't a
peaceful act when the universe was
created it was Dynamic and explosive and
and and the creative process uh um at
every level is is is
is is dynamic and chaotic and what I
feel we need to do is stop being so
concerned with just seeking for our own
uh sense of well-being and become more
interested in in taking responsibility
for the evolution of the process itself
because that's very thrilling it's very
exciting it's in it's incredibly
liberating and and to to the degree that
we're able to do that we will discover a
a sense of self-confidence because we
know we are really uh doing everything
we possibly can to make the world a
better place and we're also pushing the
edge and whenever we push whenever we
are authentically and deeply and
wholeheartedly committed to uh to a
higher purpose in a way that is as I
said truly authentic and we
are and we're taking enormous risks to
do that it's very empowering you know
because we're no longer trying to
protect ourselves you know we're we're
we're really we're really here in this
process and and we're committed to being
here and we're committed to making a
difference that I think is inherently
liberating
